friction noun [U]
(FORCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the force that makes it difficult for one object to slide along the surface of another or to move through a liquid or gas: When you rub your hands together the friction produces heat.

friction noun [U]
(DISAGREEMENT)
disagreement or unfriendliness caused by people having different opinions: friction between There's a lot of friction between my wife and my mother. Politics is a source of considerable friction in our family. Border clashes have led to increased friction between the two countries.
